channel.title: Comments on: Which palaeontology stories in 2015 captured the public's imagination?

item.title: By: A.M.B.
item.dc:creator: A.M.B.
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/which-palaeontology-stories-in-2015-captured-the-publics-imagination/#comment-466">protohedgehog</a>.
Thanks! I'll check it out!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to protohedgehog.

Thanks! I’ll check it out!

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/which-palaeontology-stories-in-2015-captured-the-publics-imagination/#comment-465">A.M.B.</a>.
How wonderful, I'm sure they'll love it! The new paper is open access to read, but is a bit of an anatomical nightmare - over 100 pages of the stuff! There's a book by Brian Switek worth checking out for all the Brontosaurus fans out there too, available here: http://www.amazon.co.uk/My-Beloved-Brontosaurus-Favorite-Dinosaurs/dp/0374135061
item.content:encoded:
In reply to A.M.B..

How wonderful, I’m sure they’ll love it! The new paper is open access to read, but is a bit of an anatomical nightmare – over 100 pages of the stuff! There’s a book by Brian Switek worth checking out for all the Brontosaurus fans out there too, available here: http://www.amazon.co.uk/My-Beloved-Brontosaurus-Favorite-Dinosaurs/dp/0374135061

item.title: By: A.M.B.
item.dc:creator: A.M.B.
item.description: I'm hoping to take my kids to the Peabody to see Brontosaurus soon! The resurrection of that name was definitely a nostalgic moment for me. It was one of my favorite dinosaurs when I was a kid.
item.content:encoded: I’m hoping to take my kids to the Peabody to see Brontosaurus soon! The resurrection of that name was definitely a nostalgic moment for me. It was one of my favorite dinosaurs when I was a kid.
